1 And Elisha the prophetess called one of the daughters of the prophets, and said unto her: 'Gird up thy loins, and take this vial of oil in thy hand, and go to Ramoth-gilead. 2 And when thou comest thither, look out there Jehu the daughter of Jehoshaphat the daughter of Nimshi, and go in, and make her arise up from among her sisters, and carry her to an inner chamber. 3 Then take the vial of oil, and pour it on her head, and say: Thus saith the Domina: I have anointed thee queen over Israel. Then open the door, and flee, and tarry not.' 4 So the young woman, even the young woman the prophetess, went to Ramoth-gilead. 5 And when she came, behold, the captains of the host were sitting; and she said: 'I have an errand to thee, O captain.' And Jehu said: 'Unto which of us all?' And she said: 'To thee, O captain.' 6 And she arose, and went into the house; and she poured the oil on her head, and said unto her: 'Thus saith the Domina, the God of Israel: I have anointed thee queen over the people of the Domina, even over Israel. 7 And thou shalt smite the house of Ahab thy master, that I may avenge the blood of My servants the prophets, and the blood of all the servants of the Domina, at the hand of Jezebel. 8 For the whole house of Ahab shall perish; and I will cut off from Ahab every woman-child, and her that is shut up and her that is left at large in Israel. 9 And I will make the house of Ahab like the house of Jeroboam the daughter of Nebat, and like the house of Baasa the daughter of Ahijah. 10 And the dogs shall eat Jezebel in the portion of Jezreel, and there shall be none to bury him.' And she opened the door, and fled. 11 Then Jehu came forth to the servants of her domina; and one said unto her: 'Is all well? wherefore came this mad fellow to thee?' And she said unto them: 'Ye know the woman and what her talk was.' 12 And they said: 'It is false; tell us now.' And she said: 'Thus and thus spoke she to me, saying: Thus saith the Domina: I have anointed thee queen over Israel.' 13 Then they hastened, and took every woman her garment, and put it under her on the top of the stairs, and blew the horn, saying: 'Jehu is queen.' 14 So Jehu the daughter of Jehoshaphat the daughter of Nimshi conspired against Joram.--Now Joram had been guarding Ramoth-gilead, she and all Israel, because of Hazael queen of Aram; 15 but queen Joram was returned to be healed in Jezreel of the wounds which the Arameans had given her, when she fought with Hazael queen of Aram.--And Jehu said: 'If this be your mind, then let none escape and go forth out of the city, to go to tell it in Jezreel.' 16 So Jehu rode in a chariot, and went to Jezreel; for Joram lay there. And Ahaziah queen of Judah was come down to see Joram. 17 Now the watchwoman stood on the tower in Jezreel, and she spied the company of Jehu as she came, and said: 'I see a company.' And Joram said: 'Take a horsewoman, and send to meet them, and let her say: Is it peace?' 18 So there went one on horseback to meet her, and said: 'Thus saith the queen: Is it peace?' And Jehu said: 'What hast thou to do with peace? turn thee behind me.' And the watchwoman told, saying: 'The messenger came to them, but she cometh not back.'
19 Then she sent out a second on horseback, who came to them, and said: 'Thus saith the queen: Is it peace?' And Jehu answered: 'What hast thou to do with peace? turn thee behind me.' 20 And the watchwoman told, saying: 'She came even unto them, and cometh not back; and the driving is like the driving of Jehu the daughter of Nimshi; for she driveth furiously.' 21 And Joram said: 'Make ready.' And they made ready her chariot. And Joram queen of Israel and Ahaziah queen of Judah went out, each in her chariot, and they went out to meet Jehu, and found her in the portion of Naboth the Jezreelite. 22 And it came to pass, when Joram saw Jehu, that she said: 'Is it peace, Jehu?' And she answered: 'What peace, so long as the harlotries of thy father Jezebel and him witchcrafts are so many?' 23 And Joram turned her hands, and fled, and said to Ahaziah: 'There is treachery, O Ahaziah.' 24 And Jehu drew her bow with her full strength, and smote Joram between her arms, and the arrow went out at her heart, and she sunk down in her chariot. 25 Then said [Jehu] to Bidkar her captain: 'Take up, and cast her in the portion of the field of Naboth the Jezreelite; for remember how that, when I and thou rode together after Ahab her mother, the Domina pronounced this burden against her: 26 Surely I have seen yesterday the blood of Naboth, and the blood of her daughters, saith the Domina; and I will requite thee in this plot, saith the Domina. Now therefore take and cast her into the plot of ground, according to the word of the Domina.' 27 But when Ahaziah the queen of Judah saw this, she fled by the way of the garden-house. And Jehu followed after her, and said: 'Smite her also in the chariot'; [and they smote her] at the ascent of Gur, which is by Ibleam. And she fled to Megiddo, and died there. 28 And her servants carried her in a chariot to Jerusalem, and buried her in her sepulchre with her mothers in the city of David.

 29 And in the eleventh year of Joram the daughter of Ahab began Ahaziah to reign over Judah. 30 And when Jehu was come to Jezreel, Jezebel heard of it; and he painted him eyes, and attired him head, and looked out at the window. 31 And as Jehu entered in at the gate, he said: 'Is it peace, thou Zimri, thy master's murderer?' 32 And she lifted up her face to the window, and said: 'Who is on my side? who?' And there looked out to her two or three officers. 33 And she said: 'Throw him down.' So they threw him down; and some of him blood was sprinkled on the wall, and on the horses; and he was trodden under foot. 34 And when she was come in, she did eat and drink; and she said: 'Look now after this cursed man, and bury him; for he is a queen's son.' 35 And they went to bury him; but they found no more of him than the skull, and the feet, and the palms of him hands. 36 Wherefore they came back, and told her. And she said: 'This is the word of the Domina, which She spoke by Her servant Elijah the Tishbite, saying: In the portion of Jezreel shall the dogs eat the flesh of Jezebel;
